attributes.action: Stop the DVLA breaking the Data Protection Act by selling personal data.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
DVLA and the Data Protection Act.

Last year the DVLA Sold our 2,000000 personal details to private companies in the guise of an administration fee charging £5.000000.00.
Major Supermarket Companies put the policing of their car parking spaces in the hands of private companies who blatantly advertise “They will obtain you details from the DVLA at Swansea”.
I believe the DVLA are in breach of the Data Protection Act as they have no control over how these details are used.
Last year the DVLA sold 2,000000 details yet did only 68 audits on the companies they sold them to.
Gordon Brown has gone on record saying “Put public services back in the hands of the public”.
The DVLA sell almost 50% of our details by electronic data transfer.
You can now be fined for parking on a white line in a Super Market Car Park yet there is no statuary size for the parking bay.
The letter you receive from the Car Park Policing Company is threatening and bullying saying they will “Put the matter in the hands of a Debt Collection Agency” 
The fines are un-reasonable and are difficult to defend in law.
